NewLimit is a biotechnology company working to radically extend human healthspan. We're developing medicines to treat age-related diseases by reprogramming the epigenome, a new therapeutic mechanism to restore regenerative potential in aged and diseased cells. We leverage functional genomics, pooled perturbation screening, and machine learning models to unravel the biology of epigenetic aging and disease using experiments of unprecedented scale.PositionNewLimit is seeking an outstanding engineer to lead software and infrastructure development to support our research platform. You will be instrumental to the design, development, and deployment of infrastructure to supporting research and development needs.As a member of our team, you will:Collaborate with our Epigenetic Editing, Single Cell Technology, and Predictive Modeling teams to create infrastructure and interfaces for data storage, transfer, and accessibility. Implement automation workflows and build, deploy, and operate hybrid lab-computational workflows and analyses. Develop and implement horizontally-scalable bioinformatics software that supports our research and product objectivesEnsure a high level of software reliability by adhering to and promoting robust engineering principles, including comprehensive testing methodologiesProactively identify, investigate, and resolve any issues that may arise, striving for continuous improvement in our software development practicesRequirementsEducation and Experience:Advanced degree in Bioinformatics, Computer Science, or a related fieldMinimum of 6 years of relevant work experience in bioinformatics software development, preferably within a startup environmentTechnical Skills:Proficiency in one or more programming languages commonly used in bioinformatics, such as Python, R, Java, or C++Familiarity with bioinformatics tools, algorithms, and databasesStrong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principlesExperience with high-performance computing and parallel processing techniquesKnowledge of software development best practices, including version control systems (e.g., Git), continuous integration, and unit testingExperience with cloud computing platforms, such as AWS, Google Cloud, or AzureOther Desirable Skills and Experience (Not Mandatory):Familiarity with regulatory requirements for drug development, including those pertaining to software used in the discovery, research, and clinical trial phasesExperience with machine learning or artificial intelligence techniques in bioinformaticsBenefitsHealth, dental, and vision insurance401(k) with company matchIndustry-leading paid time off (PTO) -- 20 days/year for all employees + holidaysPaid parental leaveMeals and snacks on-siteSalary Range: $140,000 to $190,000. Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including a candidate's qualifications, skills, competencies, and experience. NewLimit offers a competitive benefits package, which includes a 401k, healthcare coverage, and 20 days of PTO. Learn more at: https://www.newlimit.com/careers *This compensation and benefits information is based on Company's good faith estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future.
